issue.title: Don't fall back to `help` command when command is empty

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This masked issues in Bazel wrappers in a very confusing way.

Fixes #24577

issue.title: Call bash wrapper on Windows
issue.body:
- remove powershell wrapper script (it was not equivalent to the bash script and maintaining both is cumbersome anyway)
- fix the bash wrapper which would always return exit code 0 if there were no startup options (see https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/24577)
- revert the stardoc dependency update to 0.6.2, as version 0.7.2 is not compatible with older Bazel versions (CI was green because no tests were run -- see above)
- upgrade the Bazel Bash runfiles library
- use `rlocationpath` instead of `rootpath` for Bazel 8 compatibility
- disable POSIX-to-Windows path conversion in the batch wrapper (this was a problem for Bazel 5, as the triple slash we are using somehow ended up as a single slash)

issue.title: [8.1.0] Don't fall back to `help` command when command is empty

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This masked issues in Bazel wrappers in a very confusing way.

Fixes #24577

Closes #24579.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 704193424
Change-Id: Iaf486b9eb5764073439be9968f449eaf172667ca

Commit https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/40c942ac484e8a5a5834a2c7686991a4f3e42746

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.1.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.1.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.1.0rc1. Thanks!

Confirming that this is fixed in 8.1.0RC1:
```
USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.1.0rc1 bazel '' build ...
[FATAL 11:41:07.153 src/main/cpp/blaze.cc:1194] Command cannot be the empty string.
  For more info, run 'bazel help'.
```
